ns in keeping that promise i look forward to robust challenge but also i hope to the cross party support interest and engagement of this parliament i commend this statement
ns that is the promise i make today to all those past present and future who need our care
ns we will deliver that change as quickly and as safely as possible and starting now and we will ensure that people with care experience remain at the heart of the process
ns the scottish government is determined to take that opportunity we will work with local authorities care providers and all other relevant partners to make the necessary changes to care

ns today s report makes the need for action overwhelmingly clear it sets out the extent of our obligations however it also gives us an opportunity the opportunity to change thousands of young people s futures for the better
ns it is one that i take very seriously and very personally

ns in fact ensuring that they have an equal chance to succeed that they benefit from the stable loving relationships that so many of us took for granted when we were growing up is one of the most important duties we have in public life

ns throughout the care review process i have been struck by the fact that for ministers in particular but actually for all parliamentarians the responsibility we owe to young people in care is a special one
ns these groups will ensure we keep up the momentum established by the review the government aims to make progress in a matter of weeks and will update parliament regularly thereafter

ns i can confirm that both groups will include people with experience of care in fact half of the members of the oversight body including the chair who will be from outside the scottish government will be people with experience of care
ns the second is the creation of an independent oversight body

ns the first is the establishment of a team to take the report and turn it into a detailed delivery plan and although the report recognises that full implementation of its vision will take time the process of change must and will start immediately
ns but we will act straight away to implement the plan section of the report there are two key immediate elements to this

ns a radical overhaul is what the review demands and that is what we have a duty to deliver i want to be clear though that we will continue to listen to care experienced voices who have additional ideas and suggestions to make there is not and never will be a closed door
ns but today s report leaves no room for doubt that we need to do more and do it more fundamentally more systematically and more quickly
ns as the review has been doing its work the scottish government has already made some changes for example the introduction of the care experience bursary

ns what i can say unequivocally is that i am determined to get on at pace with implementing it that will involve practical change at every level but more fundamentally it will require a transformation in the culture of care

ns i hope all members will take time to read the report in full i have tried to summarise its principles and key conclusions as best i can but in the short time i have available i can t possibly do justice to the detail of the specific changes that it recommends
ns the long term human and financial costs borne not just by society but by the individuals whose experience of being let down by care impacts negatively on their life chances
ns the report also sets out very clearly the direct costs of supporting children in care and also the hidden costs of the failures of care
ns protecting family relationships and allowing children to enjoy the kind of childhood that others take for granted is often the best way of protecting children from harm

ns but we must also consider the risk created when we remove a child from their family or over burden their childhoods with bureaucracy the risk then is that we compound their trauma and make it harder for them to enjoy stable loving long term relationships
ns the report also makes an important but challenging point about risk we must always consider the immediate risk of harm to a child when we make decisions about care
ns fifth scaffolding the system that surrounds all of this of help decision making support and accountability must be more supportive and responsive
ns fourth people those in the workforce and wider community who look after children must be well supported so that they in turn can provide compassionate care and decision making
ns third care where living with their own family isn t possible children must stay with their brothers and sisters where safe to do so and belong to a stable loving home

ns second family whenever possible families should be supported to stay together with their children our first priority should be to do all we can to keep children out of care and with their own families
ns at its heart are five foundations of care firstly voice children must be heard and listened to in all of the decisions about their care
ns that must change that is why the vision and blueprint for transformational change set out in the promise is so important
ns and mired in impersonal language like placements contact and respite to describe what should be loving relationships is one i have had recounted to me many times
ns the world described in today s report of a care system which feels fractured bureaucratic unfeeling stigmatising

ns but i ve also heard too many heartbreaking stories despite the best efforts and intentions of everyone involved the actual experience of too many people in care is not what they have a right to expect
ns i have also seen first hand the dedication commitment and passion of those who work in the care sector and i want to thank them for it
ns i have also met many who are doing brilliantly even though their care experience was not good that is down entirely to their talents and resilience
ns and let me make clear i have met many young people with good experience of care who are doing brilliantly
ns indeed some of the early ones led directly to the creation of the review and as i read the report i heard from every page the voices and the stories of the kind of people i have met

ns and i know that the care experienced voice in this report is real since  i have met personally with just over a thousand young people who have experienced care i will carry these conversations in my heart for the rest of my life

ns i want to thank each and every one of those  i know that sharing stories about painful and traumatic personal experiences is not easy however by doing so you have all helped make things better for children and young people in the future

ns the review listened to more than  people more than half of them were children young people adults and families with direct experience of care the others were paid and unpaid care workers their stories have shaped everything in this report

ns perhaps the most important achievement of the review the reason its conclusions are so powerful is that it has the voices of people in care at its heart people with experience of care made up half the review s co chairs and working group members
ns i also want to pay tribute to who cares scotland a driving force behind the review s creation
ns i want to put on record my sincere thanks to fiona duncan and to all of the review group members for all the work they have put into this report they have done a truly outstanding job
ns the opportunity for scotland as a result of this report is to become the first country that makes it so and i am determined that we do
ns and this is not just true in scotland there is possibly no country in the world where the care review s vision of care is yet a living reality
ns the statistics have always told us that but in this report we hear it directly from the young people we have a responsibility for
ns to be blunt we let too many of them down they pay the price of that for the rest of their lives and in too many instances the price can be a life cut short
ns none of that should be controversial but it distresses me as i am sure it does all of us that this isn t the experience for all young people who are in or who have passed through our care
ns that allow them to experience the joys and the normal challenges of growing up and to fulfil their potential in life
ns and the priority when a child needs our care must be the provision not of a series of placements or arrangements driven by the needs of bureaucracy but of stable safe secure loving homes

ns it should have love and nurture at its heart wherever possible families must be supported to stay together when that s not possible the relationships that matter to young people particularly with brothers and sisters must be protected

ns i felt very emotional when i read the promise the report s main volume there is a powerful simplicity to what it says we and most importantly the young people who experience it should expect from a good care system

ns i am making this statement today to underline my political and personal commitment to turning its vision of how we must care for our most vulnerable young people into reality as quickly as possible
ns indeed i consider this to be one of the most important moments in my tenure as first minister so far
